title: Academy for Justice Commissioning events

government.title: 2010 to 2015 Conservative and Liberal Democrat coalition government

documents.description: In this free seminar Fiona reported on the findings of a review undertaken to assess the implementation of the Care Act and answer the key question ‘what is market shaping?’. She also explored some of the main challenges for local authority commissioners, and reflected on the implications for public care more widely.
documents.title: London seminar:  What is market shaping? (10 Nov, 2016)

documents.description: Following on from the success of our London conference, the second of our Academy for Justice Commissioning Intelligent Commissioning conferences took place in Manchester on 4 March, 2015
documents.title: Slidepack: Manchester Conference: intelligent commissioning - 20/20 vision (2015)

documents.description: In this free seminar Linda gave an update on the key features of alliancing and alliance contracts and shared the successes, challenges and lessons learned from these alliances.
documents.title: London seminar:  Alliancing in the UK Public Sector (19 October, 2016)

documents.description: The first of the Academy for Justice Commissioning's Intelligent Commissioning conferences took place in London on 29 January, 2015
documents.title: Slidepack:  London Intelligent Commissioning Conference - 20/20 vision (January 2015)

documents.description: Kevin discussed proposals for devolution of commissioning for prisons & probation & development of new ways to achieve better outcomes
documents.title: Manchester seminar:  Offender Management - Devolution and Local Commissioning (3 October, 2016)

documents.description: Speakers' presentations from this 1-day conference, which focused on 'succeeding through results' and 'partnering for success'.
documents.title: Conference: innovative commissioning (2013)

documents.description: Russell Webster made sense of the payment by results methodology
documents.title: London seminar: Making sense of payment by results (15 Sept 2016)

documents.description: Aileen Murphie, Director at the NAO outlined how commissioning can be effective in a changing landscape
documents.title: Bristol seminar:  Effective commissioning in a devolved landscape: an NAO perspective (13 Sept 2016)

documents.description: This seminar offeredthe opportunity to learn the lessons from BBC Radio about connecting with your customers, how to use data to shape your output and tips on what quality is right for your digital audience.
documents.title: London seminar:  Digital by default: lessons for commissioning services in the digital age (5 July, 2016)

documents.description: 10 years on: The impact of NHS healthcare commissioning for people in prison - informing future health interventions and prioritisation
documents.title: London seminar: No health without justice and no justice without health (23 June, 2016)

documents.description: This event will share the outcomes of a year-long cross sector Academy learning group, focused on victim services commissioning and will discuss the need for visionary leadership, a whole systems approach and design that is acutely responsive to the voice of the victim when commissioning services for victims of crime.
documents.title: Manchester seminar: Hello... is it me you're commissioning for? (16 June, 2016)

documents.description: In this free evening seminar Cliff and Richard will explore the commissioning landscape in public health services and discuss innovative commissioning approaches.
documents.title: Bristol seminar: Successful commissioning to improve public health services (9 June, 2016)

documents.description: In this free seminar Chris and Caroline outlined the early stages of a socially innovative project to develop and implement a personalised approach to offender rehabilitation in the context of Transforming Rehabilitation.
documents.title: Manchester seminar: Personalisation, Innovation and Transforming Rehabilitation (19 May, 2016)

documents.description: In this free seminar Stephen and James discussed the overall purpose of evaluation and measuring impact and looked at different approaches.
documents.title: London seminar: Impact Measurement in the justice sector and beyond:  Approaches and latest developments (13 April, 2016)

documents.description: In this free seminar Gary discussed the principles of effective and fulfilling user engagement in service commissioning.
documents.title: Manchester Seminar:  Commissioning better public services through user engagement (15 March, 2016)

documents.description: In this free seminar Dr Di Hart presented the findings of a Winston Churchill Travel Fellowship looking at child custody in Spain, the US and Finland.
documents.title: London seminar: Correction or care? The use of custody for children in trouble (9 March, 2016)

documents.description: In this free seminar Dr McCartan will discuss how reframing the commissioning of services for child sexual abuse could look using a public health approach.
documents.title: Bristol seminar: Reframing the commissioning of services for child sexual abuse (29 Feb 2016)

documents.description: This free evening seminar will seek to offer insight into the key messages, how they may be put into practice and the implications for both those commissioning and delivering services.
documents.title: London seminar: Offenders with a learning disability: Who cares and why bother? (10 Feb 2016)

documents.description: This free seminar plotted the challenges and opportunities facing policing in the 21st century
documents.title: Manchester seminar - Policing in the 21st Century: Challenges and Opportunities (26 Jan, 2016)

documents.description: This free seminar discussed the context of women offenders lives, charting what it was – and who it was that supported them to desist from re-offending.
documents.title: London seminar:  Building resilience for recovery: Insights into women's desistance from offending (14 Jan, 2016)

documents.description: Bristol seminar on working in partnership
documents.title: Bristol seminar: Partnership working post tranforming rehabiliation (9 December, 2015)

documents.title: London seminar:  Hello... is it me you're commissioning for? (3 December, 2015)

documents.description: This free seminar explored the main approaches taken in the UK to understanding and describing the impact of interventions and programmes.
documents.title: Manchester seminar: Approaches to measuring impact - what can be done when circumstances are far from ideal (1 December, 2015)

description: Details of the Academy for Justice Commissioning’s events programme and presentations from previous events.

collection_groups.title: Past seminar information and presentations
collection_groups.body:
An overview of each seminar with:

  • details of speakers
  • presentations
  • videos

details.body:
Follow @academyjustice for news about events.

Our events programme includes monthly evening seminars with guest speakers, which take place in Bristol, London and Manchester.

We also hold a commissioning-themed annual conference.

All our events are free to attend and they offer the opportunity to network and share best practice with your commissioning colleagues.

You must be a member of the Academy for Justice Commissioning to attend these events. Membership is free. Read more about how to become a member.

To register for an event, please email your details to academy@noms.gsi.gov.uk.
